title: Old Judge Harry Wright SGC Graded
author: piecesofthegame

posts.post_title: Old Judge Harry Wright SGC Graded
posts.post_content: Just got this back from grading. Classic card but 19th century is just not in my wheelhouse these days. This is the nicest SGC 10 I have ever owned. I figured it would be downgraded due to the paper loss on the left-hand side of the back but a 10? The front is virtually flawless-nice corners, nice edges, only a REAL MINOR hint of a wrinkle in the upper left hand corner that can only be seen at a certain angle-definitely not a crease. It presents like a 5 or 6. And of course the most important feature of an Old Judge is the photo quality. Wright is notorious for poor photo quality and this one is very nice and fairly dark. Great chance to own a STUNNING RARE card without paying a SGC 60 or 70 price from an auction house. I don't need to move it at this time so just testing the interest level. Price is SOLD paypal gift, mo, or check which I think is very fair considering the pleasing aesthetics of the card.
Agreed, very nice Wright card for a "1".
$2800 takes it. Also willing to work a trade involving a lower grade Cracker Jack Cobb or Wagner, '14 or '15

posts.post_title: Bump with price reduced. Now $2400 or B/O
posts.post_content: Awesome looking card. $2400 or make me a reasonable offer. Also check out the OJ Kelly in another post
You won't find one with this much eye appeal at this price.
